oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Successful Treatment of Bovine Retained Placenta by Umbilical Cord Injection of Collagenase
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eiler, Hugo
Hopkins, Fred M.
McCampbell, Hugh
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Collagen
uterus
enzyme collagenase
postpartum
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Collagen in the uterus is rapidly degraded during early postpartum by enzyme collagenase. However, during placenta retention there is a persistence of type III collagen in the bovine placentome (Biol Reprod 43:229, 1990; Theriogenology 32:485, 1989).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 173
